Eureka: Summary

 
edit

SUMMARY

  • Airs Next:SciFi at Tuesday 9:00 PM (60 min.)
  • Status:Returning Series
  • Premiered:July 18, 2006
  • Show Categories:Science-Fiction, Drama
Small town. Big secret.

A car accident leads U.S. Marshal Jack Carter into the top-secret Pacific Northwest town of Eureka. For decades, the United States government has relocated the world's geniuses to Eureka, a town where innovation and chaos have lived hand in hand.

Eureka is produced by NBC Universal Cable Studio and filmed in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.
all episode list »
edit/add

LAST EPISODE

From Fear to Eternity

Aired: Tuesday September 23, 2008

As Eva Thorne prepares to seal off the subterranean military complex, Zoe's life is endangered as her body begins to rapidly age.

USER REVIEWS

  • 10
    13
    morghanna
    member since: Nov 20, 2004
    The Bottom Line: "Better every season"

    Wonderful and amusing. ...Continue »

    My daughter and I love Eureka. It has intriguing characters that we love to watch evolve, ever changing stimulating plots, and is set in a beautiful place we'd love to live in. Yes, we are geeks and I've done my best to bring my daughter up to view intelligence as extremely more attractive than looks. With Eureka, while it does have it's attractive actors, we have a show to watch that brings about discussions, ideas, and fulfills our science fiction viewing needs in an exemplary manner. Bring more on, we love it!
    If only we knew when it will be coming back, so we could mark it on our calendars!

    01/14/09 09:05pm | report abuse
  • 9
    10
    Theophylaktos
    member since: Dec 31, 2008
    The Bottom Line: "Cutting edge"

    A scientific comedy full of mystery. ...Continue »

    I began watching it halfway through the series after a friend convinced me to watch it. I became enthralled after watching just the first half of the show and began wishing I were living inside a smart house. The only major disappointment I have had throughout the show was the death of Nathan. I didn't like him much from the start but without him the show feels a bit empty not having him and Jack bickering back and forth comically. The technology in the show would be amazing if it were possible and makes me wonder why we don't have some of it in real life. I'm just in suspense waiting for the next season.

    01/02/09 12:53pm | report abuse
  • 8.8
    50
    drdan2410
    member since: Aug 20, 2006
    The Bottom Line: "Underappreciated"

    Why don't more people watch this show it is great?! ...Continue »

    This is s fabulous show with a great cast, brilliant plots, and an excellent script.

    The show centres on Jack Carter a US Marshal who after passing through a seemingly quiet little town discovers a big secret. The entire town is in fact a top secret facillity where the most brilliant geniuses of a generation work, and soon Jack Carter is Sheriff Carter and he and his daughter are living and working in Eureka!

    This show continues to go from stength to strength and is a real joy to watch. My only concern is that my favourite character (Nathan Stark) has been killed off and I am going to really miss the dynamic between him and carter.

    The show is back in the new year and I hope that it doesn't lose any of the magic.

    12/16/08 09:10am | report abuse
  • 10
    22
    2p1k3
    member since: Jul 12, 2006
    The Bottom Line: "Absolutely fabulous"

    I like Eureka, and it is a great show. I tend to just watch a show versus trying to find fault with it. I like the show a lot though and I wish Sci-Fi would come out with more SCIENCE FICTION shows. ...Continue »

    I like Eureka, and it is a great show. I tend to just watch a show versus trying to find fault with it. I think a lot of people are that way and that is why this show is successful. I honestly wonder if they have the mojo to last and I have felt that since it started. I like the show a lot though and I wish Sci-Fi would come out with more SCIENCE FICTION shows.

    They need to replace shows like Scare Tactics and the next lame reboot of Survivor with more Sci-Fi. Better yet? Bring back shows like Angel, Firefly, Space: Above & Beyond, Crusades, The Dresdin Files, Now and Again. I mean, if they have the money to shove a lame duck like Scare Tactics our throat, then they should be able to cut some slack for a show that actually was making them money like Now and Again. However, that was CBS, the Dead Zone of Sci-Fi.

    11/18/08 10:24pm | report abuse
  • 10
    22
    Shamrock3D
    member since: Sep 15, 2008
    The Bottom Line: "Personal favorite"

    One of the best shows on Sci-Fi, If you haven't seen an episode watch it, if you have seen an episode keep watching - it is getting deeper and deeper every week. I personally can't wait for them to revisit Allison's son and his storyline. ...Continue »

    One of the best shows on Sci-Fi, If you haven't seen an episode watch it, if you have seen an episode keep watching - it is getting deeper and deeper every week. I personally can't wait for them to revisit Allison's son and his storyline. Sci-Fi channel has come out with some of the most amazing show ideas recently and personally I love it. I would wonder if their writers sit in the science fiction and fantasy sections of the library reading all the old books becasuse some of their ideas are old ones with a new spin on them.

    10/31/08 07:29am | report abuse
